title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.1: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM & ACCESS TO JUSTICE

description.narrative: National institutions have improved capacities to implement policies and deliver services to better prevent and respond to violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National institutions have improved capacities to implement policies and deliver services to better prevent and respond to violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation.

Number of UNICEF-targeted women, girls and boys provided with risk mitigation, prevention or response interventions to address gender-based violence through UNICEF-supported programmes in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of children in any form of detention who are released as part of COVID-19 release/amnesty [COVID]
Number of social service workers trained on specific knowledge and skills to deliver essential services during the COVID-19 pandemic with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]

[Number of vulnerable children, including CAAFAG, registered outside of the legal timeframe based on a supplementary judgement - jugement suppltif (disaggregated by sex)] Nombre d'enfants vulnrables, incluant les EAFGA, enregistrs en dehors du dlai lgal, sur la base d'un jugement suppltif (ventil par sexe)

[Number of children in contact with the law (ECL, ESD, victims, witnesses, civil cases, etc.) that have benefitted from access to a specialized justice mechanism or any other form of (child-friendly) legal assistance] Nombre d'enfants en contact avec la loi (ECL, ESD, victimes, tmoins, cas civils, etc.) ayant bnfici d'un accs un mchanisme de justice spcialise ou toute autre forme d'assistance lgale (juvenile).

[Number of children who experienced violence, abuse or neglect, notably survivors of SGBV and street children, provided with an individual response (medical, MHPSS, educational or socio-economic reintegration)] Nombre d'enfants ayant survcu des violences, abus ou de la negligence, notamment les survivants de violences sexuelles et bases sur le genre et les enfants de la rue, bnficiant d'une rponse individuelle (mdicale, sant mentale et psychosociale, ducative ou de rintgration

[Number of children registered in principal and secondary civil registry offices (including those in maternities, disaggregated by sex)] Nombre d'enfants enregistrs dans des bureaux d'tats civil principaux et secondaires (incluant dans les maternits, ventil par sexe)
Country has an interoperable service delivery with Health
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
